intro: Fritillaria anhuiensis f. jinzhaiensis, commonly known as the Jinzhai fritillary, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Anhui Province in China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in mountainous regions with well-drained soils and cool, moist climates. Its bulbs are adapted for storage and survival in harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
